metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8812 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
drivers/infiniband/hw/cxgb3/iwch_cm.c in the Linux kernel before 4.5 does not properly identify error conditions, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (use-after-free) via crafted packets. Venkatesh Pottem discovered a use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel's CXGB3 driver. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8812` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-11-generic - 4.4.0-11.26
linux-image-4.4.0-11-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-11.26
linux-image-4.4.0-11-lowlatency - 4.4.0-11.26
linux-image-4.4.0-11-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-11.26
linux-image-4.4.0-11-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-11.26
linux-image-4.4.0-11-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-11.26
linux-image-4.4.0-11-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-11.26
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-11-generic - 4.4.0-11.26
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-11.26').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.5').
linux-signed package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-11.26').
linux-signed-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1012.12').
